ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Exactly as the course title appears: Surviving War in the 20th Century" -- each week we read material about a particular conflict in the 20th century and focused on themes of survival, especially after the formal conflict has ended.
I would definitely recommend the course to another student- especially for those interesting in WW1, WW2 and wanting a different take on the aftermaths.
Yes, I would recommend this class to a fellow student. It is a well constructed examination of the post-war period.
It looks at important issues from a different perspective and tries to recontextualize what we think of as the postwar period.

Would not recommend - the reading list was good, but course discussions either stated what we already read and did not delve particularly into the works or the issues they represented in a disciplined way.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The books were good and reading them did help me understandSurviving War more.
